intro: Meyerafra africana, commonly known as the African wild mango, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces large, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed surrounded by a white, aromatic pulp. It is often found in moist lowland forests and is valued for its timber and traditional medicinal uses. The plant also plays an important role in local ecosystems and biodiversity.
